name: 2 - Construction procedures and ITP submitted to the Administrator seven days prior to use
2 - The Contractor shall notify the Administrator of the binder class substitution not less than 14 days prior to the commencement of spraying
3 - Contractor notified of Principal's seal design
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Seal Design by Principal
4 - Contractor provides Principal with seal design test results along with Ball Penetration test results
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Seal Design by Principal
5 - The Contractor shall submit the seal design report to the Administrator at least seven days prior to commencement of spraying operations.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Seal Design by Contractor
6 - Spraying operations shall not commence until the Administrator has approved the seal design report
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Seal Design by Contractor
7 - Cover aggregate is covered by a light plastic until it's implementation in the works
8 - Binder storage temperature measured and recordered at delivery to site
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Between 160 and 190 degrees celcius
9 - If binder temperature low, raise to within 160 and 190 degrees celcius. Heating shall be strictly observed.
10 - Three days prior to sealing operation, the Contractor shall submit details of all plant to be used.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - As per MRTS11.1 Annexure
11 - Ball penetration test results < 4mm unless approved by the administrator
12 - Ensure enough cover aggregate available on site to complete works
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Primes: >/=10 degrees
14 - Unless otherwise approved, sprayed bituminous treatments that will be trafficked shall not be sprayed if the air temperature is likely to fall below 10C at any time during the first two weeks.
14 - Current QLD sprayer certificate to be sighted
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Current Certificate
15 - Nomination and recording of cutting requirements where required
16 - Wet cover aggregate containing free surface water shall not be loaded in the aggregate spreader
17 - Loose aggregate signage requirements prior to opening to traffic
17 - Following rain, or other events causing moisture ingress, sealing shall be postponed in accordance with the table in MRTS11.1 Cl. 10
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Testing Frequency
19 - Particle Size Distribution, Flakiness Index, Avg. Least Dimension
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - One test per aggregate type, nominal size & source
20 - Texture Depth: In and between the wheelpaths - that is, 3 tests at each test chainage per direction
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Lesser of:
21 - Ball Penetration: Inner and outer wheelpaths - 2 tests at each test chainage per direction
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - 5 test chainages per homogenous section
22 - Spreading: Each spreader shall be tested in accordance with the Field Spread Rate Cover Aggregate Test (Q711A)
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - One test per spreader per day, Tolerance: ±10%
23 - Sampling of Bitumen (two x 1L samples) shall be undertaken before or during transfer of bitument to sprayers.
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Max. Lot Size
24 - The minimum frequencies for sampling and testings in regards to the cutter oil and flux oil shall be in accordance with Table 9.2 of MRTS19
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Refer to Table 9.2
25 - The minimum frequencies for sampling and testings in regards to cutback bitumen shall be in accordance with Table 9.3 of MRTS20
Acceptance Criteria & Frequency (Project Specific) - Refer to Table 9.3
Project Manager Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
